![](http://elink.turing.ac.uk/o/4/eyJhaSI6NTkyMDc5NzIsImUiOiJ2aGVsbG9uQHR1cmluZy5hYy51ayIsInJpIjoiY29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01OTQ0NGRlZWMwM2Y0NzJiYmViM2U5ZTNlN2I1MTg0NiIsInJxIjoicDEtYjIzMjQyLTU3NmIyNTFmOTkwMDQ2ZTViNWQ4YzBlYzQ0OWM4MTk3IiwicGgiOm51bGx9/m347xKusotlMJjt5Oww4Wg)

Click [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fm%2F1%2F59207972%2Fp1-b23242-576b251f990046e5b5d8c0ec449c8197%2F1%2F184%2F6e393d2e-8a2f-4948-90c4-4c4b710ba9b0&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=81Em9opLak7wlkBsruT3C9SLHSYs%2F0IsTfFH7cEZ05E%3D&reserved=0) if you are having trouble viewing this message.
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png)

Welcome to August's Turing-Roche newsletter! We hope you have had a nice summer. Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both The Alan Turing Institute, Roche and beyond.

Our [five year partnership](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FmOenM3aVgyT57V4uUtnxzA&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Qm0z3cxJXVHLoTWUMXXocQ3ADFQPxR5M%2Bsq5MhiUwIU%3D&reserved=0) was set up officially in June 2021 following a successful [Data Study Group](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FOUMjPefL1I4PT-js4DgsIQ&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=D8WB%2BXujKmn5QPALa%2BEb6vGPhKzuryFUiNlLE7vneQM%3D&reserved=0) and a 12 week research project on lung cancer treatment. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care.**

We will be covering multiple activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the wider community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at <vhellon@turing.ac.uk>

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F5J6FehOdp5qJOLBgJ_Ptpw&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=8HqZG0Oi2gHGknmGK56r%2FnbpPRIrX0RbvzaHC9GVDYQ%3D&reserved=0).

## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif)

### Knowledge Share Series Event: Natural Language Processing in Health 

**26 September 2023**

Join us for our [partnership knowledge share series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FjKG6y25l8wtgLx8Z9QUMNg&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Dzc1Lwb8aahlP3dGoKzhgzBp0jH7p4A2oTRNSrpLHIk%3D&reserved=0). Our aim is to bring together members of the Turing and Roche networks and the wider scientific community to share different academic and industry perspectives on areas related to patient/treatment heterogeneity and data science more generally.

September's event is on the 26th and this month our theme will be Natural Language Processing in Health. We'll be exploring the potential this approach may have to enable data-driven decision making, generate new insights and ultimately improve patient care.

We will be hearing from Lucia Schmidt, Postdoctoral Researcher in the Data Science Team at Roche and a Turing speaker (tbc). You can register for the event [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FrpPxXTGObqz-MOYUCXaLyg&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=zzj45Qg%2FzlVevr%2BaOSx6GkZJkRrFbXC92rgf8o46cIw%3D&reserved=0).

You can catch-up on previous recordings of our events at our [YouTube channel](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F45KQJUVHNdmvOabhNCmlZA&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=vpMESLP0pHQx%2ByE1eel00gx3KCdVThRZsAsNvs3UXWs%3D&reserved=0).

### Partnership Community Scholar Scheme

Applications for the Turing-Roche Community Scholar Scheme closed on the 31 July and we were thrilled to recieve a large amount of outstanding applications. We have now selected 10 amazing scholars to be our first cohort and they will be formally introduced in our next newsletter, so watch this space!

## Current Opportunities at The Alan Turing Institute and Roche
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/group_study_working__0.jpg)

### Applications Open for the Turing Institute's Fellow Scheme

**Deadline: 18 September 2023**

Turing has opened applications for its Turing Fellowships which are aimed at established researchers who have potential to be the next generation of world leaders. Fellowships will be offered on a two-year unfunded basis, commencing January 2024. Fellows will be proactive in their engagement with the Institute and receive benefits that being part of the Turing's vibrant, interdisciplinary and collaborative research community brings in exchange for notable contributions to the Institute's goals and successes. You can find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPVhKd1RDeGw5OFJ4SDE2SUlUZXpld3ByZEZWTGtSRWYxWEl4V2p3Yy1RZHNvRWpMZXdqbVF5RVFadDVDWGxCa2kmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01OTQ0NGRlZWMwM2Y0NzJiYmViM2U5ZTNlN2I1MTg0NiZlc2lkPTZmNzQ0ZTUwLTM3NDAtZWUxMS1iZGYzLTYwNDViZDBlNjc5NSJ9%2Fp-4Q35w4AspmoAgTA4Jahw&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=zfYbi2bxrhlsC3n%2BnBRTqqsR%2BkpnXqHHexYE4sanuhI%3D&reserved=0).

### Join Roche's Product Development Data Sciences Team

Roche are encouraging data scientists who want to drive innovation in healthcare to join their talent pool. The Product Development Data Sciences team comprises experts from fields such as data and statistical sciences, epidemiology, outcomes research, mathematics, programming, informatics, and software development. [This article](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPVhKd1RDeGw5OFJ4SDE2SUlUZXpld3ByZEZWTGtSRWYxWEl4V2p3Yy1RZHNvRWpMZXdqbVF5RVFadDVDWGxCa2kmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01OTQ0NGRlZWMwM2Y0NzJiYmViM2U5ZTNlN2I1MTg0NiZlc2lkPTZmNzQ0ZTUwLTM3NDAtZWUxMS1iZGYzLTYwNDViZDBlNjc5NSJ9%2FUH3gI9hQXtpKRI8403dJvQ&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=97MMwivWNqQjF3fAD9Ws%2B%2F6PAeGnhHNmPST0bqkEBvk%3D&reserved=0) interviews four scientists who are part of the team and gives insights into their day to day. Information about how to join the talent pool is at the bottom of the article. 

### Turing PhD Student Presentation and Networking Day

**29 September 2023**

The Turing Connections initiative aims to develop a more cohesive network of cross-organisational data science and artificial intelligence doctoral students by creating and signposting opportunities. On the 29 September 2023 they are hosting a PhD Student presentation and networking day at the Turing Institute, which is free to attend and includes lunch. You can register for the event [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F-WjZ9V-WdxEIDNIO50Q9iw&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=fAYGgrrPZIH%2FQuSN2nmS2m9H4Uy5UpaoRV%2F8Q0UHB9U%3D&reserved=0).

### 4-year University of Bristol PhD Scholarship funded by Roche: AI-Generated Genomes for Privacy-Preserving Collaboration in Human Genomics

**Deadline 31 August 2023**

The Faculty of Health Sciences at the University of Bristol have opened applications for a 4 year PhD studentship, funded by Roche. They are looking for a candidate interested in the use of computational and data science methods for generating synthetic genomic data sets by applying cutting-edge AI approaches. More information on the role and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_cDE2MDA5MiZfY2xkZWU9WEp3VEN4bDk4UnhIMTZJSVRlemV3cHJkRlZMa1JFZjFYSXhXandjLVFkc29Fakxld2ptUXlFUVp0NUNYbEJraSZyZWNpcGllbnRpZD1jb250YWN0LTQ4ODBhOGMzOTIzY2VjMTE4YzYyMDAyMjQ4NDM0ZmViLTU5NDQ0ZGVlYzAzZjQ3MmJiZWIzZTllM2U3YjUxODQ2JmVzaWQ9NmY3NDRlNTAtMzc0MC1lZTExLWJkZjMtNjA0NWJkMGU2Nzk1In0%2FoSAVTl7mIP7t-5Z-RJBROw&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ws2w8ajQ62Z5dgDKpaaIQSgSj5Hbx%2F%2BManr8%2FmlLRsg%3D&reserved=0).

## Events
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/ags-0057_800-px-wide.jpg)

### #VizTIG- Turing Visualization Interest Group Symposium 2023

**14 September 2023**

[Turing's Visualization Interest Group](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FwOW6IkAqC_v6ja1hHpUypA&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=3jeQAo5zJX1c9ms7KrhBrkmLh3jk5VGI0rTOqPdwPPQ%3D&reserved=0) are hosting their fourth annual symposium at Kings College London. The day will feature guest speakers and lightning talks, with lunch provided plus excellent networking opportunities - all culminating in the keynote speaker of Professor Alex Telea from Utrecht University. Register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FmhsTKboHJVvMGYfDa9_hRg&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188015700%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=XpBPsOnJFEnC%2FrkLZDB4fAtFDrRGZZG3FOUASDYokGI%3D&reserved=0).

### AI & Machine Learning in Health Services Symposium at Brighton and Sussex Medical School

**19 September 2023**

[Heads On](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F13JKfwO6Aq_vPKVDp_CKOw&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=fYm58f%2FXwUOKrGgD6HYqDGwhke4UhVcZZsiccknadg0%3D&reserved=0), The Health Foundation and Brighton And Sussex Medical School are hosting a one day symposium on the 19 September exploring how AI can support informed decision-making in healthcare. The symposium will cover best practice from clinicians on using data with patients, the value of data and how it influences decision making, AI support that can contribute to financial savings and a showcase of The Health Foundation's Advancing Applied Analytics Programme. Free registration [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fj-olILXKK1ML_8wNMm3TQA&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=rDJX3mxI5qV2hzIhYSBuCRre6JuaQ5j3YwzxK8UhTzQ%3D&reserved=0).

### Genomics England Research Summit 2023

**19 September 2023**

The Genomics England Research Summit is a one-day, in-person event being held in London. It will explore the latest research and technology innovations from Genomics England, partners and complementary fields. More information and registration [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FQOfzDYcjc5rhCfkzm4oB4g&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NJ%2BEY133aqopSqnxra%2FW35iKTkpOt28c47uVPVic438%3D&reserved=0).

### Equality, Diversity and Inclusion in Science and Health (EDIS) Symposium**

**26 September 2023**

The 2023 EDIS Symposium brings together researchers and professionals from across the science and health research sector on the theme of inclusive leadership. Speakers and delegates will share exciting and emerging practice on designing, implementing and rewarding inclusive leadership at all levels. The one day event will take place at the Francis Crick Institute. Register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FzejuFhD0UONRDF7ErURfPw&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=pcdK9hHbLnkdXwsCD0oXrAZ4NMMmXT4oU6xiUBpYxsM%3D&reserved=0).

### Qualitative Health Research Network Conference (QHRN)

**28-29 February 2024**

The sixth QHRN will focus on what the community has learned through crisis and continued disruption, and how this has the potential to aid understanding and inform progress in the field of qualitative health research. It will be a virtual conference with a range of supplementary in-person events held at University College London. There is a call for abstracts with the deadline of 03 October 2023. More information on the conference [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FJtM29keL83gM6cr7X0eSQA&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=720wiGw372ofA1CbRMHH%2F0CbeaM41nWxNqv7HTV%2B3po%3D&reserved=0).

## Other Opportunities

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/alex-shutin-204369-unsplash.jpg)

### University of Birmingham PhD Position: Natural language processing of electronic health records to improve empirical prescribing in acute admissions

**Deadline: 30 August 2023**

The University of Birimingham, in collaboration with the pharmaceutical company Shionogi, are hiring for a PhD position funded for 4 years full time study. The student will be working on a project aiming to analyse free-text clinician notes to retrieve valuable information that can improve the prescribing of antibiotics by more accurately predicting an individual patient's risk of having an antibiotic-resistant infection. Further info on the role and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FDb8vZF8mpZ48BSYx7zcK5w&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ehN1YYBsSsfNSuX0eUwrOXJfOjubXC0bkgv4GDjpFWw%3D&reserved=0).

### Queen Mary University of London Postdoctoral Research Associate Position: Cardiac AI/Digital Twin

**Deadline: 18 September 2023**

The Digital Environment Research Institute at Queen Mary University London has a new three year Postdoctoral Research Associate position open in cardiovascular AI and digital twins, funded through a recent NIHR Biomedical Research Centre Award. Ideal candidates will be knowledgeable about AI in healthcare including deep and machine learning, image analysis (computer vision) and time-series modeling. More info and application information [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPVhKd1RDeGw5OFJ4SDE2SUlUZXpld3ByZEZWTGtSRWYxWEl4V2p3Yy1RZHNvRWpMZXdqbVF5RVFadDVDWGxCa2kmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01OTQ0NGRlZWMwM2Y0NzJiYmViM2U5ZTNlN2I1MTg0NiZlc2lkPTZmNzQ0ZTUwLTM3NDAtZWUxMS1iZGYzLTYwNDViZDBlNjc5NSJ9%2FeLcEptZsNPochYucFNko6A&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=nHOE2xOIxxkKthjKcy9Fg%2BO%2Bob7R0c%2BBj9XtCGcIUD0%3D&reserved=0).

### Open Innovation in Life Sciences Hackathon

**23-24 September 2023**

[Open Innovation in Life Sciences](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FpI3bmZwwGWdsBVxbx-EJxg&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=2zQvayVy3D%2B7q3VXRP8o7oMGmubiscJABQXcqn83m%2BU%3D&reserved=0) (part of Life Science Zurich) is hosting a 24hr no-code hackathon, sponsored by Roche, bringing together young scientists, healthcare-enthusiasts, and open science-curious researchers to develop innovative solutions to urgent digital health challenges. With support and feedback from mentors and experts, participants will get a chance to develop innovative solutions and pitch their ideas to a jury with the chance to win exciting prizes. More information [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fs3-nkhWDZMZ_OOqDhObAlA&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=MgPRhmvNB0SCVZuSjlDjqhgEU2z9ybbGwtoeT2wwkV0%3D&reserved=0).

## Publication of the Month

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg)

### The FSHD muscle-blood biomarker: a circulating transcriptomic biomarker for clinical severity in facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy

August's publication of the month is from our partnership senior postdoctoral research associate Chris Banerji and his collaborators. Published in Brain Communications, the [paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fp5L20zK5EwdJDxMJCTnOEQ&data=05%7C01%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C5fdbdc7851bd4cc67b6708dba94099ba%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638289867188171952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=fVk%2FWqGr6tiJSDOwq3xDRAP5SQyiAwiFc8zfVDE9H2c%3D&reserved=0) identifies a circulating, minimally invasive muscle-blood biomarker for Facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy (FSHD), a prevalent, incurable skeletal myopathy. Currently used heterogeneous biomarkers are poorly associated with clinical severity and also require an invasive muscle biopsy. Therefore this newly identified biomarker may be of potential use in routine disease monitoring and clinical trials.
